headline: Micron Technology (MU) Is Up 7.2% After Hiking 2026 AI Capex To $20 Billion – Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In recent weeks, Micron Technology has reported record revenue growth, sharp margin expansion, and fully booked high-bandwidth memory capacity for 2026 as AI-driven demand and supply constraints reshape the global memory market. A key development is Micron’s decision to lift its fiscal 2026 capital expenditure plan to US$20.00 billion, signaling how aggressively the company is building out capacity to meet this surge in high-value AI memory demand. Next, we’ll explore how Micron’s expanded...

headline: Micron stock pops on AI-driven demand: Bull vs. bear case
summary: Micron (MU) stock is up as artificial intelligence (AI) drives demand for high-bandwidth memory. D.A. Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria, Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss Micron's position in the AI trade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Micron stock pops on AI-driven demand: Bull vs. bear case
content.description:
Micron (MU) stock is up as artificial intelligence (AI) drives demand for high-bandwidth memory.

D.A. Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria, Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss Micron's position in the AI trade.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Assessing Micron Technology (MU) Valuation After A Strong Month Of Share Price Momentum
summary: Micron Technology (MU) has drawn fresh attention after recent trading left the stock with a 1-day return of about a 1% decline but a gain of roughly 32% over the past month. See our latest analysis for Micron Technology. That pullback comes after a 6.7% 7 day share price return and a 31.6% 30 day share price return, while the 1 year total shareholder return is very large at just over 3x. headline: Sandisk stock soars after Nvidia CEO calls memory storage "unserved market"
summary: Investing.com -- Sandisk stock surged 27% Tuesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang described the memory storage chip market as an "unserved market" with massive growth potential. Other memory and storage stocks also rallied, with Western Digital jumping 17%, Seagate Technology rising 14%, and Micron gaining 9%.

content.title: Sandisk stock soars after Nvidia CEO calls memory storage "unserved market"
content.summary: Investing.com -- Sandisk stock surged 27% Tuesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang described the memory storage chip market as an "unserved market" with massive growth potential. Other memory and storage stocks also rallied, with Western Digital jumping 17%, Seagate Technology rising 14%, and Micron gaining 9%.

headline: Memory Stocks Surge as Shortage Is Expected to Worsen
summary: Sandisk, a maker of NAND flash memory, surged 25% while hard-drive makers Seagate and Western Digital jumped 14% and 17% respectively.  Micron, which produces primarily DRAM memory chips, was up 8.7%.  In a report Monday, market research firm Trendforce projected that contact prices for NAND flash memory will jump 30%-35% just in the first quarter of this year.

content.title: Memory Stocks Surge as Shortage Is Expected to Worsen
content.summary: Sandisk, a maker of NAND flash memory, surged 25% while hard-drive makers Seagate and Western Digital jumped 14% and 17% respectively.  Micron, which produces primarily DRAM memory chips, was up 8.7%.  In a report Monday, market research firm Trendforce projected that contact prices for NAND flash memory will jump 30%-35% just in the first quarter of this year.

headline: Wall Street reaches more records on more gains by Big Tech
summary: Broad gains led by technology stocks pushed Wall Street to more records.  The gains mirror much of the action from the previous year, when big technology stocks often drove the market to a series of records.  The S&P 500 climbed 0.6%, driven by more gains from tech giants including Microsoft and Amazon.
